DOC.brief_summary: This study conduct assess diagnostic predictive value light induced fluorescence intraoral camera versus visual-tactile assessment method accord FDI criterion clinical evaluation margin resin composite restoration
DOC.brief_title: Reliability Light Induced Fluorescence Intraoral Camera Versus Visual-Tactile Method Assessment Marginal Integrity Resin Composite Restorations : Diagnostic Invivo Study
DOC.detailed_description: Each patient least one resin composite restoration . The restoration evaluate two diagnostic method . Each examiner record dental finding use visual- tactile assessment method fluorescent-aided identification method . The visual-tactile assessment method include use mirror , FDI probe good illumination condition , fluorescent-aided identification method perform light induced fluorescence intraoral camera reliability diagnostic tool assess .
DOC.criteria: Patients 18 year age . Patients acceptable oral hygiene level . Patients must least one posterior resin composite restoration . Patients compromise medical history . Severe active periodontal disease . Heavy bruxism traumatic occlusion .
